channel.description: Join Barron’s for an exclusive live conversation with journalists and guests. Our editors and reporters will examine the pandemic and its impact on markets, the economy, companies and individuals. Topics include Managing Your Money, The Future of Health Care, What to Watch in the Markets, Tech Stocks, and more.

item.title: What Lies Ahead for the Art Market
item.description: Clare McAndrew, founder of Arts Economics, will discuss her mid-year snapshot of the global art market for Art Basel and UBS with Penta senior writer Abby Schultz ahead of a landmark series of New York auctions including the sale of Paul Allen’s US$1 billion collection.

item.title: Barron's Midterms Election Roundtable on Barron's Live
item.description: The midterm elections will determine the balance of power in Washington and set the stage for the coming two years. Tax policy, tech regulation and much of President Biden's agenda may hinge on the outcome. Join as Barron's and MarketWatch journalists lead a discussion with political and investing experts on what to watch, what to expect, and what it all means for your portfolio.

item.title: Luxury Real Estate Hot Spots
item.description: The luxury real estate destinations in the U.S., including Nashville and Gulf Coast Florida, that have been on fire during the pandemic are finally normalizing, and negotiability between buyers and sellers is back, according to the third-quarter Emerging Housing Market Index from The Wall Street Journal and Realtor.com. Join Realtor.com senior economist George Ratiu, Rebecca Norris DiNapoli, a Compass agent based in Nashville, and Jay Phillip Parker, CEO of Douglas Elliman in Florida for a discussion of the hottest markets and a look-ahead to 2023. In conversation with Mansion Global reporter Leslie Hendrickson.

item.title: Financial News - Crypto vs Blockchain - What's Next?
item.description: The crypto winter has rocked the sector. But is the underlying technology still up to scratch? As the retail phenomenon that was digital assets turns into an institutional opportunity, are banks overlooking the potential of blockchain in their businesses? Join Financial News for a Barron's Live as we ask former UK chancellor Philip Hammond why he has turned his hand to advising crypto custodian Copper, and what a future digital financial assets market based on blockchain could look like.

item.title: MarketWatch: Making Sense of the Latest Student Loan News
item.description: Student loan borrowers could be forgiven if they can't keep up with the latest news on the topic. The Biden Administration recently released its application for debt relief, some legal challenges are still pending, while others have been dismissed and the Department of Education is in the midst of implementing other reforms to the student loan system. Join MarketWatch Deputy Enterprise Editor Jillian Berman and Institute of Student Loan Advisors Founder Betsy Mayotte to discuss the latest student loan news.

item.title: Will The Release Of Oil Reserves Really Lower Gas Prices At The Pump?
item.description: Can consumers expect lower prices at the gasoline pump in response to the release of more oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve? Join as Myra Saefong, senior reporter at MarketWatch, interviews Tom Kloza, global head of energy analysis at OPIS, an energy information and data provider. Examine the forces that are driving retail gasoline prices and what consumers should expect to pay in the coming months.

item.title: How Russia's Power Play Will Hit Consumers and Reshape Energy Markets
item.description: Europeans are bracing for a difficult winter and economic pain after Russia cut energy exports to the continent. Join as Barron's senior managing editor Lauren R. Rublin and energy experts from McCloskey by OPIS examine the impact on consumers in Europe and the U.S., how the energy ecosystem is adapting, and what the absence of Russian fuel means for the future of nuclear, coal, renewables, and natural gas.

item.title: MarketWatch - How to Balance Retirement Savings and Student Loans
item.description: President Biden recently announced Americans riddled with student debt could see as much as $20,000 of their loans forgiven. Join MarketWatch retirement reporter Alessandra Malito and Byrke Sestok, a certified financial planner at Rightirement Wealth Partners, as they discuss how borrowers should balance paying down the rest of their debt and saving for retirement, or how to prioritize that extra cash flow if their loans have been wiped clean.

Greg and MarketWatch reporter, Jeffry Bartash will be joined by the President of the Peterson Institute for International Economics, Adam Posen.

item.title: Be Well - Real Estate’s Buzziest Amenities
item.description: Wellness amenities are a must for luxury homes, with buyers expecting an array of options—from infrared saunas to state-of-the-art air filtration systems—as standard features. Others go straight to the source, opting for branded residences attached to resorts with world-class wellness programs. Join Anna Bjurstam, strategic advisor and wellness pioneer for Six Senses and Raison d’Etre, in conversation with Mansion Global reporter Leslie Hendrickson about wellness options for the home, whether that’s a Los Angeles mansion or a chalet at the Six Senses Residences Kitzbuehel Alps.

item.title: Retiring Abroad: What It's Like to Live in Southern France

She discusses her experiences with Silvia Ascarelli, the author of MarketWatch's "Where Should I Retire?" column.

item.title: Financial News - Crypto Winter: How Long Will It Last, What's Next?

item.title: Spotlight on the Sun Belt
item.description: Remote work has lured many U.S. buyers to the Sun Belt, where they can find more space for less. Sun Belt cities account for several of the top 10 luxury destinations on The Wall Street Journal/Realtor.com’s most recent Emerging Housing Markets Index, including the No. 1 luxury locale on the list: Wilmington, North Carolina. Join Mansion Global and market experts.

item.title: Annuities: When They're Right and When They're Not for Your Retirement
item.description: When it comes to retirement planning, it's not just about saving enough money for the future but ensuring income streams are stable to last the rest of one's lifetime. Join MarketWatch's retirement reporter Alessandra Malito and Michael Finke, Retirement Income Institute Research Fellow at the Alliance for Lifetime Income, as they explore when annuities are appropriate, why they may be misunderstood and how to find the right one.

item.title: Caught Flat-Footed During March Rally? How To Filter Out The Noise
item.description: Investors have been bombarded with negative headlines in 2022: inflation, rising rates, war in Ukraine and more. And if you rely on headlines alone, you can miss big shifts in the market, like what we saw in mid-March. Join Investor’s Business Daily news editor Ed Carson and Alissa Coram, IBD’s multimedia content editor, as they discuss how investors can filter out the noise by focusing on market signals, industry rankings, chart patterns and more.

item.title: MarketWatch - Retiring Abroad: What to Know About Life in Panama
item.description: Kris Cunningham never expected to move to Panama in retirement. But she and her husband did just that about a decade ago and live happily in a city of about 83,000 people near the Pacific Ocean. She'll discuss her experiences with Silvia Ascarelli, the author of MarketWatch's "Where Should I Retire?" column, and answer questions from the audience.

item.title: Strategies to Beat Out the Competition in a Hot Housing Market
item.description: With housing inventory at historic lows, many homes are seeing multiple offers and selling for hundreds of thousands of dollars over their list prices. How can a buyer beat out other bids? Redfin chief economist Daryl Fairweather and agents Shoshana Godwin, based in Seattle, and Michael Stein, who works in the Boston area, talk about the best strategies—and those to avoid—buyers can use to edge out the competition for their dream home.

item.title: How High Will Gasoline Prices Go?
item.description: Examine the forces pushing gasoline and diesel prices higher amid the conflict in Ukraine, and what could be done to stem the rise. What is holding back increased production in the U.S.? What are the investing and economic implications of rising fuel prices, from air travel to supply chains? Lauren Rublin, senior managing editor of Barron's, interviews Denton Cinquegrana and Tom Kloza, senior oil analysts at OPIS, a Dow Jones energy data and analysis company.

item.title: Women, Their Retirement Security and What To Do If You Feel Behind
item.description: Men and women do not approach retirement savings the same way -- aside from different investing behaviors, women have historically earned less because of the gender wage gap, or left the workforce mid-career to care for their children or elderly loved ones. MarketWatch's retirement reporter Alessandra Malito and Cindy Hounsell from the Women's Institute for a Secure Retirement discuss women's retirement security and what can be done to prepare for the future.

item.title: How To Find New Leaders & Get Your Watchlist Ready For An Uptrend
item.description: When a correction takes hold, investors may be reluctant to sell some of their big winners even though they’re taking hard hits. Investor’s Business Daily deputy markets editor David Saito-Chung and Alissa Coram, IBD’s multimedia content editor, discuss why you shouldn’t hold beaten-down leaders of the past and how to find emerging market leadership. Plus, they’ll review how to get your watchlist ready for the next uptrend.
